net.markenwerk.utils.json.parser

Class DefaultJsonPushParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.markenwerk.utils.json.parser.DefaultJsonPushParser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, JsonPushParser

    public final class DefaultJsonPushParser
extends Object
implements JsonPushParser
    A DefaultJsonPushParser is a stream based JSON parser. It reads characters from a given Reader as far as necessary to calculate a JsonState or to yield the next value.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Torsten Krause (tk at markenwerk dot net)

    • Method Detail

      • handle

        public <Result> Result handle(JsonHandler<Result> handler)
                       throws IllegalArgumentException,
                              JsonHandlingException,
                              JsonSyntaxException,
                              IOException
        Description copied from interface: JsonPushParser
        Handle the character sequence from the JsonSource and report to the JsonHandler.

        Calling this method closes the underlying JsonSource, but it can be closed manually.

        Specified by:
        handle in interface JsonPushParser
        Type Parameters:
        Result - The result type of the JsonHandler.
        Parameters:
        handler - The JsonHandler to report to.
        Returns:
        The result that has been calculated by the given JsonHandler.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given JsonHandler is null.
        JsonHandlingException - If the given JsonHandler failed while handling an event.
        JsonSyntaxException - If the JSON text contains a syntax error.
        IOException - If reading from the underlying JsonSource failed.
